body.name: The Inn at Willa Bay: A Willa Bay Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #93,795 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #1,530 in Women's Friendship Fiction #2,720 in Contemporary Women's Fiction #3,128 in Contemporary Women Fiction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Zoe,Meg and Cassie were friends who looked after their elderly friend. Zoe lived in a cottage on her property where once it had been a successful inn. One day they were out and Celia was rubbing her leg but what Zoe asked her about it she said it was her arthritis acting up. One day Zoe came home from work and Celia's little dog who was never away from Celia was in the window pawing at the window so Zoe knew something was wrong. She tried the door but it was locked. When she finally found the spare key she found Celia on the floor uncousious. She was trying to get the remote control when she fell. Zoe called an ambulance and when they got her to the hospital and checked her out she had a fractured hip and a broken arm. She was in a coma for awhile. Zoe didn't know who was her next of kin was. She called her friends Grandmother and she said to look in Celia address book for someone named Shawn. When Zoe found his number he had no idea who Celia was or why she listed him as her next of kin. It turned out he was Celia's grandson who didn't even know about Celia. When Celia was young she was going to marry a young man who was killed and she never got to tell him she was pregnant. After she had the baby she fell into a depression and couldn't take care of her so being her cousin and her husband wanted children but couldn't have them Celia gave her the child to raise as her own. The only stimulation was that Celia not have any contact with the child until the child was of age but although Celia tried, and the cousin to explain to the girl why Celia had to give her up the girl never forgave her and that's why Shawn didn't know Celia. Zoe and Shawn got to know each other when he flew up from South Carolina for Celia. Eventually they had to go through her bills and found out Celia hadn't paid taxes on the property in years. When they mentioned it to Celia she said she didn't have the money. So instead of Celia losing the property Zoe came up with a plan with her brothers help to buy the property and fix it up . Only she wanted her friends to be partners with her and Celia's grandson Shawn to do the carpenter work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This book builds the base
reviews.reviewText: This book builds the relationships in Willa Bay. 1. The 'Wedding Crashers' are the core females for all the books. They are actually various professionals in the wedding venues business. eg. event coordinator, baker, wedding cakes, etc. 2. The owners and their soninlaw/daughter of currently popular venue. 3. The owner of the now decrepit venue/inn. Her emergency contact.This is a very interesting build of relationships as times in Willa Bay are changing. You kinda get the impression of the first new love relationship and hints for the others.Really need to read book 2 for progress.This is a very clean romance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Book 1 The story of friends and an old Inn
reviews.reviewText: Once again author Nicole Ellis brings us a story of friends who support and love each other and bring us into a story were you wish you were part of. Zoe Tisdale has wanted to be a wedding planner since she played with her dolls, so working at The Lodge at Willa Bay was a dream job until Zoe was passed over for a promotion. Feeling trapped into a job that she now hated everything was about to change when her landlady Celia James falls, breaking her hip. femur and in a coma. Reaching out to an unknown person Shawn Curtin who a surprise relationship to Celia is unfolding into Shawn, Zoe and another friend Meg Briggs buying half the Inn and returning it to its natural beauty. Another friend Cassie Thorsen was asked to join the team, but Cassie has always wanted to own a bakery. So all the friends come together with all its ups and downs of getting the Inn open to make it a great nice story. There were a couple of times were things were mentioned but dropped with no further mention, not a big deal but recognized to the reader.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s a Great Value driven journey
reviews.reviewText: The interaction of family who are friends is as amazing as the descriptions detail of living with ourselves and our perceptions of yesteryear. It comes full circles in all those blessed to dream of their own destiny.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: At chapter 3, 30 pages in, this is very slow moving and has way too many characters to keep track of. Finally picks up the pace but still difficult to keep track of everyone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I had trouble telling the characters apart, and it still gets 4 stars!
reviews.reviewText: I had trouble telling the characters apart, but it didn’t matter: all the women were the Good Guys, and everyone connected with the owner was a Villain.The book was full of people caring about each other (except for the Villains), and the plot was well-done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Sweet easy read. Great summer vacation book. The characters were kind, caring and optimistic throughout. It's nice to have something well-written like this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thoroughly enjoyed this book.
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed reading this and it is refreshing to find an author who does not see the need to include any bad language in her writing. I know in reality many people use foul language on a daily basis and many authors feel they have to include it to make the writing realistic, but I do not use it and I do not like to read it. So I am happy I found this book. I hope other books by Ms. Ellis will follow the same pattern of interesting stories, people who love and care for each other, and no foul language or lurid sex scenes.Thank you Ms. Ellis!!!
J'aime beaucoup ce livre, quand on le lit je me sens paisible et relaxer, je me sens comme si j'étais avec elle sur le bord de la mer
Good read.... the happiness they could find in their friendship... and Nicole did a wonderful job narrating the events in a special way ...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 28, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: A beautiful book to escape into
reviews.reviewText: This was such a joy to read. Beautifully written and full of truths about the everyday struggles in life. It tells you about friendship, working and juggling parenthood, working life and so much more. There is even a budding romance with a handsome man. I can't wait to read the second one. It shows that taking a leap of faith can sometimes change you life, no matter how scary it first seems. Well done Nicole Ellis on a truly lovely story. It gives me hope.
Loved this book look forward to reading the other ones in the series.

This book is about Several good friends with life concerns. Each friend has worries about jobs, family, friends, family, money and changing responsibilities within their work environment.Cassie is trying to make it in the baking business and doing all the baking at the Lodge, until someone try’s to make her look incompetent. Zoe works in the same lodge where she is not awarded the position she was working towards due to nepotism. Meg comes home to their small town from Portland when her Mum was ill, and will never become head chef due to changes in the Lodge and their good friend Celia falls and breaks her hip and leg.Celia’s Inn is threatened with back taxes, and Celia’s grandson finally meets his Grandmother for the first time.The common thread is saving a rundown seaside resort, for all of the friends, but they aren’t sure if it is possible.Through their trials they join forces, and things work out nicely for them all eventually. This book is a fun read, full of warmth and great human interactions.
